In the method's comment, you wrote that in case of 'default' you return 0 and not -1.

Checklist for code review: Structure - Is the code well-structured, consistent in style, and consistently formatted? - Are there any uncalled or unneeded procedures or any unreachable code? - Can any code be replaced by calls to external reusable components or library functions? - Are there any blocks of repeated code that could be condensed into a single procedure? - Are symbolics used rather than “magic number” constants or string constants (hardcoding)? - Are any modules excessively complex and should be restructured or split into multiple routines? Documentation - Is the code clearly and adequately documented with an easy-to-maintain commenting style? - Are all comments consistent with the code? Variables - Are all variables properly defined with meaningful, consistent, and clear names? - Do all assigned variables have proper type consistency or casting? - Are there any redundant or unused variables? Loops and branches - Are all loops, branches, and logic constructs complete, correct, and properly nested? - Are the most common cases tested first in IF ELSEIF chains? - Are all cases covered in an IF ELSEIF or CASE block, including ELSE or DEFAULT clauses? - Does every case statement have a default? - Are loop termination conditions obvious and invariably achievable? - Can any statements that are enclosed within loops be placed outside the loops? Defensive programming - Are imported data and input arguments tested for validity and completeness? - Are all output variables assigned? - Is every memory allocation deallocated? - Are all files and devices are left in the correct state upon program termination?

issue.summary: Good job. Class and code written very well and clearly.
issue.desc: Excellent description of the use of the class, and good documentations of methods with explanatory comments. I didn't find great problems in the code, it seems without error. Excellent development.
